intro: Triumfetta berteroi, commonly known as the red sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing shrub or perennial herb with small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often blooming in late summer or early autumn. Its seeds are enclosed in small, three-lobed capsules that disperse easily by wind. Triumfetta berteroi is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in harsh, drought-prone conditions.
